howToGetIt: Becoming an adoptive parent starts with getting accredited as a resource parent. Whether your goal is fostering or adoption, state certification is mandatory. AFS recognizes the diverse paths to family building and ensures tailored resources and support for every family's unique journey. LEARN ABOUT BECOMING AN AFS RESOURCE OR ADOPTIVE PARENT CONTACT US (800) 300-1022 rfarecruitment@afs4kids.org Or visit https://family.binti.com/users/signup/afs-rfa to start an application. AFS is licensed to cater to counties like Alameda, Contra Costa, San Francisco, Solano, Marin, Sonoma, and Sacramento. For queries, contact: (800)300-1022 or rfarecruitment@afs4kids.org.
cost: Adopting through foster care is free. Families might also qualify for a monthly stipend for child care and Medi-Cal benefits until the child is 18 or, in some cases, 21.
